newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai rice ends up on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai rice ends up on short-covering.

text.p: Shanghai rice futures ended up on Tuesday on short-covering with open interest falling, trders said.
The key October contract ended at 1,890 yuan ($227) per tonne, rising 70 yuan. It opened at an intra-day high of 1,899 and hit a low of 1,850. December rose 100 yuan to 2,050 yuan.
Combined volume rose to 5,700 tonnes from 2,600.
Traders said most investors had lost interest in the market and had liquidated their short positions, which were responsible for today's rises.
"The fall in open interest indicated long and short position holders liquidated their positions today," one trader said.
The open interest of the October contract fell to 830 lots from Monday's 950 lots. One lot is five tonnes.
Traders said many investors had lost interest in the dull contracts and had left for the more active stock market and other futures markets.
